intro: Haplodiscus elatus, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive lobed shape. Haplodiscus elatus is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
